results.summary: Eco Design for Airframe - Re-use of Thermoplastics Composites
results.content: Eco Design for Airframe - Re-use of Thermoplastics Composites

descriptionByte:
Scope:

In the context of re-use of Thermoplastic Composites, the objective of the work package is to contribute to the development of technologies to enable the reuse of thermoplastic composite waste with the creation of concrete demonstrators. This project is limited to define typical material characterization needed and development one typical process. The recycled material (ready for re-use) should be compatible with press moulding and injection moulding processes.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
            Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals"
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment

An Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

Please note that on 12 Janaury 2015 there were significant updates made to the following topic descriptions. Please see the new version of the Annex III (Topic Documents Document) for details.

results.summary: Flightworthy Flush & Lightweight doors for unpressurized Fast Rotorcraft
results.content: Flightworthy Flush & Lightweight doors for unpressurized Fast Rotorcraft

keywords: AER Aerodynamics of External and Removable items
descriptionByte:
Scope:

Three different doors have to be developed and manufactured for the Fast Rotorcraft (FRC). It comprises of the Pilot-, Passenger- and Cargo Doors for e.g. rescue mission. The doors have to be developed, manufactured and acceptance tested according to the requirements for a Fast Rotorcraft  (min. impact on drag & max. operational performance).  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
            Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals"
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015)
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme

On 26 January 2015 the link for the ethics review was added to the PartB templates and the comment concerning the definative version being in the submission system was removed.
Please remember that an Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed. See the comments in the Excel table.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened during the first days of the week commencing 26 January 2015.

"},{"approvalDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:58:22 PM","lastChangeDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:57:59 PM","content":"

On 21 January the templates for drafting Part B.I and Part B.II of the proposals were uploaded to the information package of this call. 
An Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

Please note that on 12 Janaury 2015 there were significant updates made to the following topic descriptions. Please see the new version of the Annex III (Topic Documents Document) for details.

  • FRC-02-03
  • FRC-02-05
  • FRC-02-06
  • FRC-02-07
  • FRC-02-08
"}]

results.summary: Bird strike - Erosion resistant and fast maintainable windshields
results.content: Bird strike - Erosion resistant and fast maintainable windshields

descriptionByte:
Scope:

A complete set of lightweight windshields for the Fast Rotorcraft has to be developed, manufactured and tested. This encompasses both sides of the front area as far as the upper pilot- and the lower- windshields. The requirements for a High Speed Helicopter (min. impact on drag & max. operational performance) and the requirements for bird strike resistance according to EASA CS29 have to be fulfilled.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
          
    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals"
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Curved stiffened panels in thermoplastics by preindustrial ISC process
results.content: Curved stiffened panels in thermoplastics by preindustrial ISC process

descriptionByte:
Scope:

The aim of this CfP is to manufacture a curved stiffened structure in thermoplastic representative of an aero-structure (i.e wing, fuselage panel or engine cowling) preferably with double curvature using thermoplastic high strength material (i.e PEEK) and an advanced pre-industrial “in situ consolidation” process through adaptation and enhancements of existing machine into a more advanced prototype.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
            Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals"
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment

"},{"approvalDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:58:22 PM","lastChangeDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:57:59 PM","content":"

On 21 January the templates for drafting Part B.I and Part B.II of the proposals were uploaded to the information package of this call. 
An Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

Please note that on 12 Janaury 2015 there were significant updates made to the following topic descriptions. Please see the new version of the Annex III (Topic Documents Document) for details.

  • FRC-02-03
  • FRC-02-05
  • FRC-02-06
  • FRC-02-07
  • FRC-02-08

results.summary: New enhanced acoustic damping composite material
results.content: New enhanced acoustic damping composite material

descriptionByte:
Scope:

The activities will be oriented on development of innovative composite materials, from different suppliers, to meet future aircraft program needs and requirements. Both structural and non-structural materials will be considered.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
           Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals".
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules

On 26 January 2015 the link for the ethics review was added to the PartB templates and the comment concerning the definative version being in the submission system was removed.
Please remember that an Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed. See the comments in the Excel table.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened during the first days of the week commencing 26 January 2015.

"},{"approvalDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:58:22 PM","lastChangeDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:57:59 PM","content":"

On 21 January the templates for drafting Part B.I and Part B.II of the proposals were uploaded to the information package of this call. 
An Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

Please note that on 12 Janaury 2015 there were significant updates made to the following topic descriptions. Please see the new version of the Annex III (Topic Documents Document) for details.

  • FRC-02-03
  • FRC-02-05
  • FRC-02-06
  • FRC-02-07
  • FRC-02-08
"}]

results.summary: Structural bonded repair of monolithic composite airframe
results.content: Structural bonded repair of monolithic composite airframe

descriptionByte:
Scope:

The activities will focus on mid-term needs for innovative faster repair process of monolithic composite airframe (fuselage and box structures) and long-term repair processes for future epoxy and thermoplastic materials.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
            Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process:  described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals".
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Simulation tool development for a composite manufacturing process default prediction integrated into a quality control system
results.content: Simulation tool development for a composite manufacturing process default prediction integrated into a quality control system

keywords: NUM Numerical Models (including Fast Time Simulati
descriptionByte:
Scope:

In the frame of non desctructive testing  integration on the manufacturing line, the activities will be oriented on the development of an innovative simulation tool of a composite manufacturing process capable to predict typical default that will interact with non desctrutive inspection tools, it will be oriented on a specific process defined by aeronautical stakeholders.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
           Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals".
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call. 
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment

The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

results.summary: Design Against Distortion: Part distortion prediction, design for minimized distortion, metallic aerospace parts
results.content: Design Against Distortion: Part distortion prediction, design for minimized distortion, metallic aerospace parts

descriptionByte:
Scope:

Develop rapid distortion prediction methods for machining and additive layer manufacturing (selective powder sintering of metals).  Topology optimisation accounting for distortion.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
           Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals".
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules

On 26 January 2015 the link for the ethics review was added to the PartB templates and the comment concerning the definative version being in the submission system was removed.
Please remember that an Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed. See the comments in the Excel table.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened during the first days of the week commencing 26 January 2015.

"},{"approvalDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:58:22 PM","lastChangeDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:57:59 PM","content":"

On 21 January the templates for drafting Part B.I and Part B.II of the proposals were uploaded to the information package of this call. 
An Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

Please note that on 12 Janaury 2015 there were significant updates made to the following topic descriptions. Please see the new version of the Annex III (Topic Documents Document) for details.

  • FRC-02-03
  • FRC-02-05
  • FRC-02-06
  • FRC-02-07
  • FRC-02-08
"}]

results.summary: Engine Mounting System (EMS) for Ground Test Demo
results.content: Engine Mounting System (EMS) for Ground Test Demo

descriptionByte:
Scope:

Design, manufacture, assembly and instrumentation of an Engine Mounting System for UHPE  Ground Test Demo ; EMS Set for characterization and validation through Partials tests : manufacture, assembly and instrumentation, mechanical tests.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
            Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals".
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Development of an all-oxide Ceramic Matrix Composite (CMC) Engine Part
results.content: Development of an all-oxide Ceramic Matrix Composite (CMC) Engine Part

descriptionByte:
Scope:

Based on functional requirement of an Inter Turbine Duct component, the partner is expected to provide codes , optimisation strategies and mechanical simulation tools for the design of such a component  as well as to characterize the chosen material and to provide qualified parts for engine demonstrator testing.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold:  described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
            Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals".
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call. 
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Characterisation of Thermo-mechanical Fatigue Behaviour
results.content: Characterisation of Thermo-mechanical Fatigue Behaviour

keywords: NUM Numerical Models (including Fast Time Simulati
descriptionByte:
Scope:

The proposed project is focused on the development of predictive tools and experimental techniques to characterise thermo-mechanical fatigue (TMF) crack initiation (CI) and crack propagation (CP). Experimental data will support the calibration and validation of the predictive tools, where characterisation of the metallurgical damage mechanisms is required to support this.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")

On 26 January 2015 the link for the ethics review was added to the PartB templates and the comment concerning the definative version being in the submission system was removed.
Please remember that an Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed. See the comments in the Excel table.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened during the first days of the week commencing 26 January 2015.

"},{"approvalDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:58:22 PM","lastChangeDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:57:59 PM","content":"

On 21 January the templates for drafting Part B.I and Part B.II of the proposals were uploaded to the information package of this call. 
An Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

Please note that on 12 Janaury 2015 there were significant updates made to the following topic descriptions. Please see the new version of the Annex III (Topic Documents Document) for details.

  • FRC-02-03
  • FRC-02-05
  • FRC-02-06
  • FRC-02-07
  • FRC-02-08
"}]

results.summary: Advanced analytical tool for the understanding and the prediction of core noise for large civil aero engine with low emission core
results.content: Advanced analytical tool for the understanding and the prediction of core noise for large civil aero engine with low emission core

keywords: NUM Numerical Models (including Fast Time Simulati
descriptionByte:
Scope:

The current proposal is aimed at understanding the flow physics involved in the generation and propagation of combustion noise through turbine blade rows in low emission core aero engines and developing advanced analytical combustion noise prediction tool for industrial purpose. This tool will be used to design a quieter (i.e. low noise) low-emission technology for the middle-of-market VHBR engine in WP5 of Engine ITD, and for the large engine market VHBR engine demonstrator in WP6 of Engine ITD.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")

The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
            Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals".
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment

An Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

Please note that on 12 Janaury 2015 there were significant updates made to the following topic descriptions. Please see the new version of the Annex III (Topic Documents Document) for details.

  • FRC-02-03
  • FRC-02-05
  • FRC-02-06
  • FRC-02-07
  • FRC-02-08

results.summary: VHBR Engine - Advanced bearing technology
results.content: VHBR Engine - Advanced bearing technology

descriptionByte:
Scope:

To develop and demonstrate various individual technologies required to deliver rolling element bearings with increased load carrying capacity. This should be interpreted as delivering up to 15% higher rolling contact stress capability with no detrimental impact to component life and operational speed than is available from today’s aerospace bearing materials.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")
additionalInfos:
{"additionalInfo":"

The Model Implimentation Agreement Document was added to this web site on 13th March 2015.
The 3rd and final release of the Questions & Answers Document was uploaded on 12 Match 2015.
Both documents can be found by Clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

To download any document from the list in the "Call Documents" section just click on the "EN" link after the document name.

Important updates were made to this call on 13th February 2015. 

An update to the CS2 JU Workplan 2014-2015.

An update to the Full Description of Topics (ANNEX III)

You can find these documents by clicking on the "Call Documents" tab above this text.

"}
supportInfo:
Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

H2020 Online Manual your online guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant
sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.
topicConditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: described in part A of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in part B & C of the general Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
    Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1  Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in part F of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015.
            Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014/2015.

    3.2 Guide to the submission and evaluation process: described in the document "Rules for submission, evaluation, selection, award and review procedures of Calls for Proposals".
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template (to be published before end of January 2015).
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement:
    Signature of grant agreements: maximum 8 months from the date of closure of the call.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms for the type(s) of action(s) under this topic:
    The proposal templates will be available in the submission system (SEP).
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Clean Sky 2 Budget Flexibility:
    See Part G of the General Annexes of the Clean Sky 2 JU Work Plan 2014-2015.
     
  8.  JTIs additional documents
    Clean Sky 2 Joint Technical Programme
    Clean Sky 2 JU Financial Rules
    Clean Sky 2 JU Regulation of establishment

results.summary: Crack growth threshold analysis in TiAl alloys
results.content: Crack growth threshold analysis in TiAl alloys

descriptionByte:
Scope:

This programme will investigate the fatigue crack growth threshold of second generation TiAl alloys suitable for use in the IP turbine of the UltraFan engine. The alloy will be defined by Rolls-Royce. This package of work will determine the fatigue crack growth threshold and crack growth rates, evaluate the effects of temperature and also the effects of the variation in properties within the designated heat treatment window. The influence of original defect size and morphology is also within scope.  Please refer for the full and formal topic description to Annex III of the Clean Sky 2 Work Plan 2014-2015 Amendment nr. 1  Version 3 (see under the tab "Topic Conditions and Documents")

Clean Sky 2 Helpdesk:  Info-Call-CFP-2014-01@Cleansky.EU

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals

National Contact Points (NCP)

Enterprise Europe Network – national contact points' advice to businesses with focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

Clean Sky 2 National Contact Points - Clean Sky 2 JU States Representative Group

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research and EU R&I programmes

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

Ethics – for compliance with ethical issues, see the Participant Portal and Science and Society Portal

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations, advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal

sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service of the topic, please select the type of action that is most relevant to your proposal from the list below and click on the 'Start Submission' button. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action, the topic for the call, as these cannot be changed subsequently in the submission system. Upon confirmation you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Participant Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.

On 26 January 2015 the link for the ethics review was added to the PartB templates and the comment concerning the definative version being in the submission system was removed.
Please remember that an Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed. See the comments in the Excel table.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened during the first days of the week commencing 26 January 2015.

"},{"approvalDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:58:22 PM","lastChangeDate":"Jan 21, 2015 7:57:59 PM","content":"

On 21 January the templates for drafting Part B.I and Part B.II of the proposals were uploaded to the information package of this call. 
An Excel version of the tables which are embedded in Part B.I is also available in case needed.
The submission system for uploading the completed templates will be opened in due course.

Please note that on 12 Janaury 2015 there were significant updates made to the following topic descriptions. Please see the new version of the Annex III (Topic Documents Document) for details.

  • FRC-02-03
  • FRC-02-05
  • FRC-02-06
  • FRC-02-07
  • FRC-02-08
"}]
